WRITING.TITLE: My first cake: Lane southern cake
When somebody says "you've been so brave" it likely means "you're out of your mind for doing that".
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

I won't do that, is a beautiful thing to believe in something that give sense to our lives, I appreciate you respect I don't believe either, also I find religion a fascinating way to understand the human being.

i really understand and most of all respect the sense of community, when is well understood and free, of course. I mean, as any social group the sense of belonging is quite reconforting. I personally don't need any church to now right from wrong or to act in consequence, also I consider there are many things within the Christian Church that are wrong. The Bible itself is heavily redacted, and you can see how they left out Thomas' Gospel because it didn't fit their narrative, when, in my opinion, is the most beautiful of them all. Still, I could talk about this for hours, I find it very interesting.

I truly don't understand that someone studies the Bible and still believes that the message make any sense. I can understand feith and I have nothing to say about someone who truly believes and can't help it as I can't help not to believe. I also study the Bible and though I think is quite an interesting piece of literature and a fascinating sociological document, the contradictions are too extensive for me to be able to get a clear message. Sometimes I debate with believers and Bible experts and still don't get it. They usually argument that sometimes is literal and sometimes is a hidden message under the scriptures. I mean, if I was really a believer I would literally believe in everything the Bible says, and if so, most of the Bible is inaccurate.

Historically, Jesus could had been saved by the Jewish Sanhedrin, specifically when Poncius Pilate (Judea's governator) ask them if they wanted to liberate Jesus or Barrabas, a known thief. The Sanhedrin chose Jesus, and Poncius Pilate didn't quite understood the choice and so he said. The problem was basically that Jesus represented a menace for the Jewish, they considered him a revolutionary, because his teachings advised that the Jewish religion was getting corrupt (as for example he advocated for more justice toward the woman, who were heavily discriminated at that time). The romans didn't care too much for Judea at that time, it was a distance province without much political weight in the central administration, but for the Sanhedrin, it started to get dangerous as more and more people followed Jesus. Is interesting that Jesus didn't declare that he was God's son until he was almost 31 years old, and even then, he was pressured to do it, and didn't open admitted so. The first time he did it was to Herodes, and it was because Herodes said: "You claim that you are God's son", and Jesus answered: "Is you who are saying that, not me". So, in a sense, he had to die because he was a revolutionary and this was to destabilizing for the Sanhedrin.

[Product question] Can The Ordinary Vitamin C serum cause break outs?
WRITING.TEXT: So, I've just received my vitamin C 23% with HA spheres serum from The Ordinary and applied it tonight. Then, I checked in cosdna and it has 'Ethylhexyl Palmitate' which has a comedogenic rate of 4, so it worried me. Have any of you experienced problems with this product? I have an acne prone skin.

WRITING.TITLE: Can The Ordinary Vitamin C serum cause break outs?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]
Thanks, I've ordered the BHA sample, lets give it a try.

Is like an electrical dermarolling, is not very expensive, you can check it out, [here](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2qxJWJ4wiYc) is a video [here](http://radiancemedispa.co.uk/aesthetics/nanopore/) is some info. I also use retinol and BHA (Cosrx Blackhead Power liquid) for PIH.
I guess so, it doesn't mention it in the source, but I don't believe it neither.

WRITING.TITLE: We'wha, 1849 - 1896, New Mexico, known as "The Zuni Man-Woman"

WRITING.TEXT: **Skin profile:** Acne prone, PIH | Oily **Season Type of Climate:** Mediterranean, very humid **1st Cleanser:** Avene Micellar Water + Albolene (for eye makeup) **2nd Cleanser:** Apivita cleansing gel with propolis and lime **pH Adjusting Toner:** Klairs supple preparation toner **Vitamin C Serum:** Vitamin C Suspension 23% + HA Spheres 2% **BHA:** Cosrx Blackhead power liquid **Essence:** Hada Labo super hyaluronic acid lotion **Ampoule:** The Ordinary Niacinamide 10% + Zinc 1% **Light Moisturizer:** Isdin Nutradeica **Medium Moisturizer:** The Fresh Phytoncide Pore Gel Cream **Heavy Moisturizer:** Benton Snail Bee High Content Steam Cream **Eye Cream:** Naruko Taiwan Magnolia Brightening and Firming Vitamin K Eye Cream EX and Isdin K-Ox Eyes **Facial Oil:** Rosehip oil + Tea Tree oil **Sheet Mask:** Naruko tea tree Shine Control and blemish clear mask + Naruko Q10 age-defying brightening mask **Sunscreen:** Isdin Water Fusion + Naruko Tea Tree Sunscreen **Spot Treatment:** Duac gel + Mizon Acence Blemish Out Pink Spot **Other:** Biretix gel (retinol) and Isdin Auriderm

Wow, this has been super helpful, thank you very much. One question, I've just bought [this](http://ordinaries.com/product/rdn-niacinamide-10pct-zinc-1pct-30ml) but I think is not as effective as what you mention (I found several articles about what you mention and it seems to be effective only together). The Olay cream is very expensive, is there any cheaper option that you are aware of?
Again, thanks.
That's great. Thanks!

That's my doubt, it seems that BHA is better for oily skin and AHA for pih, and I don't know the percentage of Cosrx, I wanted to know if there's something higher that I can use...
Yes, I've read it, I meant if you could offer me some advise about brands you've used and seem to work.

WRITING.TITLE: [Routine help] BHA or AHA?
WRITING.TEXT: Hello, I've been dealing with PIH for a few months. I have been using Cosrx BHA Blackhead Power Liquid since last summer but I've just run out and I don't know if buying it again or if I should purchase another type of exfoliator. Do you have any advice? I have very oily skin, acne prone and I'm Spanish, so mediterranean, olive skin. I would really appreciate some advise, thanks.

WRITING.TITLE: [Product advise] BHA or AHA?
WRITING.TEXT: [removed]

My dermatologist prescribed me [this](http://www.isdin.com/eng/products/isdinceutics/k-ox-eyes-eng), she told me that vitamin k is very effective for dark circles and they seem to be clearer after 1 week. For the bags, when I wake up with them, I use a gel eye mask (the one you put on the freezer) for a a couple of minutes.
Edit: I also use vaseline over the eye cream to retain moisture, it was an advise a redditor gave me.
Asian, definitely Biore Aqua rich watery essence. I also use Naruko Tea Tree Oil sunscreen because it works well when I have acne break outs, and non AB Isdin Water Fussion.
